medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 5 days before admission with gradually increasing orthopnea and dyspnea on exertion, associated with mild leg edema. Two days before admission, intermittent substernal chest tightness developed, accompanied by nausea, vomiting, and a cough productive of blood-tinged sputum. The night before admission, worsening dyspnea led the patient to the emergency department of another hospital.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of Gravesâ€™ disease, carpal tunnel syndrome, anemia, urinary tract infections, previous cesarean section, and two spontaneous abortions 16 and 13 months before admission.
medical_history.family_history: Father died at 60 years of age from myocardial infarction; maternal grandmother died of stroke. Family history of hypertension and hypercholesterolemia in father, maternal grandmother, and mother; sister with nephrolithiasis and asthma.
medical_history.social_history: Patient is from South America, moved to the United States 5 years prior, lives with husband and children, works as a housecleaner, does not drink, smoke, or use illicit drugs.
